title: Firefly inks multi-launch deal with Lockheed Martin for Alpha rocket rides
summary: The agreement includes 15 firm launches as well as options for an additional 10 missions

title: Starliner lifts off on crewed test flight
summary: Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft is in orbit on its first crewed flight after two recent launch scrubs and years of development delays.

title: Boeing Starliner launches for the first time carrying NASA astronauts to the ISS
summary: Boeing launched its first Starliner flight with astronauts on Wednesday, beginning a crucial final flight test of the long-delayed spacecraft.

title: The Satellite Breakup: Military’s Push to Go Small
summary: Taking cues from the Space Development Agency, the Space Force is  rethinking its future satellite architecture

title: Uncontrolled reentry of space debris poses a real and growing threat
summary: The Florida crash landing of space debris jettisoned from the ISS has spun up worrisome views regarding the escalation of human-made space debris plummeting to Earth in an uncontrolled manner.

title: Pale Blue gets additional funds for water vapor thrusters
summary: Pale Blue has raised an extra $8.5 million in venture capital to mass-produce water vapor propulsion systems and upgrade the technology, the Japanese small satellite thruster developer announced June 4.

title: Slingshot unveils AI that spots satellite anomalies and potential bad actors
summary: The AI tool named ‘Agatha’ was developed under a DARPA contract

title: Electron launches second NASA PREFIRE cubesat
summary: A Rocket Lab Electron rocket launched the second of a pair of NASA cubesats designed to monitor infrared emissions at the Earth’s poles.

title: Hubble Good for Another Decade Despite Gyro Woes
summary: NASA said today the beloved Hubble Space Telescope will continue making discoveries into the mid-2030s despite failing gyroscopes. Of the six gyros that enable the telescope to point at specific […]

title: Boeing’s Starliner CFT launches on third attempt
summary: After years of anticipation, Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner capsule has flown its first crew into space on the 100th flight of an Atlas V launch vehicle. Capping off Starliner’s test campaign, the Crew Flight Test (CFT) has sent Barry Wilmore and Sunita Williams on a trajectory to rendezvous with the International Space Station (ISS) where they will remain for about a week.
